input_text.Prompt: Can you tell me how to tell if an employee is looking for a new job?
input_text.Response A: Some signs that an employee might be looking for a new job include if they are frequently absent from work, if they are not completing their work tasks, or if they are not following company policies. If you notice any of these behaviors, it might be a good idea to talk to your employee and see if there is anything you can do to help them.
input_text.Response B: There are a few common signs that an employee is actively looking for a new job.  First, they may start to miss a lot of days, or come in late, without a good reason.  Second, their performance may start to decline, or they may become more prone to making mistakes.  Third, they may start to look for opportunities to show off their accomplishments or praise themselves, as if to build up their own resume.  Finally, they may start to look at other job opportunities, apply for new jobs, or talk to headhunters.

input_meta.preamble_a: Respond using only short words and simple language, as if you were talking to a child.
input_meta.preamble_b: Respond authoritatively, assertively and persuasively, as if you are very knowledgeable about the topic.
